text: Came to Bali for our honeymoon and we couldn't of wished for better. The villas were exceptionally clean, the staff were brilliant and very accommodating, literally waiting on us hand and foot! Breakfast is delivered to the room at your preferred time, and every breakfast was lovely. The location is great, 5 min walk to the beach, and a five minute, minus much traffic, drive to centre of town. Mini and Darma should be singled out for their effort to please us, they knew a lot about the area and the tours they knew about too, and were happy to help whenever we needed anything, but all staff down to the security guard at the gate were fantastic. We booked a tour to ubud through the hotel and that was charged to the room so no need for dodgy dealings with the number of horn happy cabbies wanting to take you places, and the tour arranged was a private tour too. If we ever come back I would be sure to stay here again.

text:
Stayed in seiryu for a week last month. 

I chose seiryu because i needed a private pool with spacious size of villa. In that matter, seiryu was the right choice, but service was definitely disappointing. 

During the check in, staff didn't even bring the room key, which she didnt even notice until i gave a call to front desk.  No information on wifi, not a single explanation regarding the villa. I just had to open all the cupboards and figure things out by myself. I stayed four different villa type properties in bali, never experienced and expected such service in here. (Normally, they walk with you and show you how to use things and what is included and what not. )

And twice, a particular staff in front desk, she didn't even greet me. 

And, breakfast is so boring. I skipped, i think 4 times out of 7. There normally are so much healthier options in other properties with same range of price or even slightly lower.

However, security staffs were very friendly. And most of staffs were very kind.
title: Disappointing service

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We've stayed in many different villas yet The Seiryu stands out!

Upon entering the foyer the first thing I noticed was how amazingly quiet and peaceful it is. The Seiryu is enclosed on all sides with thick walls that do an excellent job keeping the hustle and bustle of Seminyak on the outside. This is not easy at all as Seminyak is probably the busiest beach resort destination in Asia.

But then an architectural paradox awaits when you enter your villa: we stepped inside to find a Japanese-inspired garden and private pool all to ourselves. The only way I can describe the experience is 'Zen Cocoon' - very calming, very quiet, and safely protected from the chaos outside.

I love the Japanese-inspired design features: Samurai sword shaped door handles and timber-walled bathroom that feels like an onsen. Very unique indeed.

In keeping with The Seiryu's Japanese influence, I would also like to commend the "ninja trained" housekeeping team who are not seen or heard... we'd head outside and they would enter the villa from a service entrance and clean up after us. Every time we entered the villa it was immaculate. Love it!

Lastly I would like to add the high ceiling in our villa and chandelier that hangs from the apex gives the villa an elegant feeling. I loved relaxing inside looking out to the garden through the glass at the end of the living room.

Thank you very much to everyone at The Seiryu, we shall return!
title: Zen Cocoon

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We have just had 11 nights at the Seiryu Villas over the Christmas/new year period.  B1 Villa.  Fantastic staff, breakfasts were excellent, the filtered water bottle machine a huge plus.  7 min walk max to the beach (which was covered in rubbish due to on shore breeze), make sure you book the beach club which consists of 4 chairs and 2 umbrellas (very hard to find, located between Crystal Palace and a construction site and not branded) , 3 times we walked down there and there was noone there, when we complained after 3rd time the Villas said they would escort us down and if there was noone there, they would rent us two chairs.  Mosquitoes a major issue outside at the villa, we bought coils and had 3 or 4 burning all the time, but this isn't the Villa's fault, they do spray, seems to be water under the deck which probably doesn't help.  just take aerogard and buy coils at 7-11.  Cannot fault the staff or the service it was superior.  Food wise, turn right and walk to corner, there's Bintang Warung a local eating place, fab food - seafood soto (soup), chicken soto, sate, nasi goreng, crispy chicken and very cheap - think the chicken soup was $2.50.  Walk for another maybe 5 min and there's a fabulous seafood restaurant on your left - run by a Balinese man and his Aussie wife Anne Marie - the best whole bbq snapper we had on this trip - we went there 3 times, great sate, clams, calamari and really reasonable for the top level quality - cheapest bintang at $1.80 in whole trip.
title: 11 great nights

text:
It was our first trip to Bali and we randomly selected Seiryu based on tripadvisor's reviews. 
The stay turned out to be one of our best experiences thus far, comparable to International 5* standards.

The villa was clean, staff were very prompt and friendly. 
We were told that there are only 8 villas in the premise and probably that's why they can ensure prompt and attentive service throughout our stay.

Breakfast served were excellent, we loved the croissants! :)

One tiny drawback was that the aircon in our living room leaked for 2 days despite their prompt "rescue". However, it was not much of an issue cos there's 2 aircon units in the main area, 1 in the living room and another near the bed. Even at one time u only have 1 unit running, it doesn't affect the temperature in the villa at all.

The fully equipped kitchen (which has ANOTHER aircon unit) even has a water dispenser(which provides hot & cold water), this is on top of 2 FOC bottled waters given daily. Very thoughtful! I guess this villa is very condusive even for families who has kids as well. Not forgetting that there's a private pool and Jacuzzi.

We will definitely select Seiryu if we visit Bali again.
title: Wonderful Experience

text:
5 nights was not long enough!!! ... great location, extremely relaxing and beautifully appointed villa with everything you need. 

Value = tick
Private = tick. 
Comfy Big Bed = tick
Pool = tick.
Mini Bar = tick.
Movies = tick
Room Service = tick.

Generally, I don't like 'themed' accommodation - but it was a subtle, less is more kinda aesthetic ... very Japanese :) which I found great! The only thing I didn't like about my villa were the plastic plants .... not that they were hurting anyone or anything, I just felt they weren't necessary. Other than that, my wife walked away with ideas for our home. The staff were fantastic, room service breakfast, lunch and dinner all brilliant especially with the staffs own entrance into the kitchen which added to the privacy, and the courtesy call in the morning prior to breakfast was appreciated. Definitely a couples retreat within the hustle of Seminyak, Bali.
title: Silence at the 'Silent Dragon'

text: If you are looking for heaven on earth in bali, you have found it. My husband and I barely got out of the pool and we almost wasted a day filled of activities just to relaxed and get spoiled by its Zen ambience. Looks exactly the same as in the pictures and the service was excellent as described by others. Shut out to widi and winnie for pampering my husband and i like a king and his queen. I would definitely make a comeback to this humble abode.
title: Great for honeymooners and first time travelers to Bali

text: Seminyak and its beach weren't as nice as hoped; however, the villa alone almost makes a return trip worth it. Service is impeccable with the staff remembering our names and room numbers for whatever service we requested. They have a good included breakfast service running from 7 am to 11 am, but would often provide us with a boxed breakfast at 6:30 am when we had early morning excursions. The wife has a very sensitive nose and was in love with the fragrances they have around the villa and property. The location is in a more quiet section of Seminyak but within walking distance to shops, restaurants, and the (dirty) beach. Easily one of the best parts of our honeymoon trip.
title: Honeymoon highlight

text:
I booked a very great deal on Zuji for a birthday trip for my boyfriend. 4 Days and 3 Nights @ The Seiryu Villas. We got room A4. 

The set up:
It was a beautiful private pool villa. Californian King size bed, ilving room with a big screen TV and a comfy low rise couch, make up desk for the ladies with a huge mirror, there is also a separate room that consists of the dining room table and kitchen. This is great if you want to whip up a quick meal during your stay. The bathroom has a nice rain shower and a bathtub that has air jets in it. The bathroom has a door that leads directly INTO the pool. Literally, you can jump in first thing in the morning. 

The outside has two sun beds and one queen sized lounge bed right at the end of the other side of the pool. The Seiryu Villas design has Japanese influence and gives a great Zen feel during the whole stay. 

The Grub:
Each evening you can choose your complimentary breakfast choice before returning to your villa. Breakfast choices: American, Indonesian, Japanese. Each choice as dish options. We had the American and the Japanese breakfast. Verdict? American breakfast was better. We didn't dine at the Villa for lunch and dinner so no info there.

Location:
It's very convenient to the shopping street strip. All you have to do is turn left at the villa entrance and then choose to turn right or left depending on which way you want to shop. If you want a more Westernized shopping and eating district head over to Laksamana which is only a 5 min drive or 15 min walk from the Villa. Legian is a bit further but great for the nightlife.

Transportation:
I highly suggest to rent a scooter/motorcycle on your stay as it's super convenient. If you choose to take the taxi around here are some good tips:
1. Ask for them to put on the METER. Or....
2. Bargain a good price before you get into the taxi.
3. Use Blue Bird Taxi Group (the number one taxi company and safest)
title: Beautiful & spacious

text: The Seiryu Villas is nicely located a few minutes walk from my favourite stretch of beach in Seminyak. The Villa itself is excellent and service impeccable. It has Japanese elements throughout which is pleasantly appreciated. Room itself is fairly large and well appointed with all the usual amenities provided. Pool was great, although it can get a bit noisy in the day due to some construction of a new hotel opposite. Overall, I highly recommend it!
title: Japanese themed villa near seminyak beach

text:
there are a lot of villas in seminyak area which suitable for honeymooner, but Seiryu is the best in my opinion

i and my wife tried the one bedroom royal pool villa type during our recent stay last Saturday 

the villa was very clean and well maintained 
breakfast was lovely served in our villas with choices of American, Japanese and Indonesian 

we both agreed that this whole concept of Seiryu Villas was perfect for honeymooner which adopted from Japanese history and beautifully combined with Balinese touch.

From the main entrance, lobby, reception, corridor, and the villa itself as its own history.

Great villas, superb service, nice food and we really enjoyed our stay
title: a real hineymoon villa

text:
Every place has its positives and negatives, I'll just pin point few of my negative experiences which I guess people should know as I stayed at couple of places in Bali. So I can really differentiate with the services.
First of all, the photos I saw was entirely different to see it in real. No doubt they are big and clean but they don't give a feeling of a villa, being a five star category they don't have that kinda furniture, Its all Jute furniture which does not give comfortable feeling at all, furniture gets 0 out of 10. They don't have that lavish kinda feel of a villa (of the amount I paid for each night). In reality a couple always need just one suit bedroom to stay, but I paid for a villa which was more than double, so expect it to be lavish with all the facilities. They only had 20-25 movies stored in some hard drive.They have one big room which is divided into two section, one for bedroom n other for living room. I again didn't find that great. There is a walkway on the back side of the villa which is basically meant for room service, but due to that the villas had no privacy, they served breakfast in the dinning room while we were asleep, n that made us feel uncomfortable.
I went there on my honeymoon, only one flower was kept on the bed and it was named as the honeymoon setup. That was disappointing.
I stayed in Park Regis in Bali, Kuta. That was also a suite room with swimming pool connected to my room, and I paid less than half of what I paid in the villa and I was happier there than in the villa. Park Regis was cleaner, the staff was good there, serves hot breakfast, but the only difference is they have a buffet system. 
Now coming back to the staff of villa, I found them very good, but one thing I would like to mention is I guess they lack communication within themselves. They told me that they will provide me free taxi service from the villa to airport, n when I got out of the taxi at the airport I had to go n exchange money because that was not communicated to the taxi driver, amount was not too big to crib about but the trouble to exchange money and then pay it to the driver at the airport and then having a feeling of betrayal of what they said was not delivered was not good. 
YOU CAN LOOK FOR A BETTER PLACE FOR SURE.
title: Average Stay

text:
I stayed here with my boyfriend from 12/02/2014 until the 16/02/2014. Don't get me wrong the hotel was nice. It's very new so the rooms are nice but my initial thought when entering the room was it actually looks a lot more downgraded then the photos. It is in a good location it is in walking distance to a lot. 
The service was what turned me off. We were meant to have afternoon tea included every day which we only got once. The breakfast was of good value. I made a mistake in booking and accidentally booked an extra night. I approached the service desk (which never had anyone there) and asked about my options. I was told that they would check with the manager and get back to me. No one returned my query even after confronting them a second time. 
However a female staff member was a saint throughout our stay as my partner was severely sick just before leaving for a flight. She would continuously check on us and brought medication for my partner. She was very helpful. Overall it was average. But for the price you pay you are better off staying somewhere else
title: Bit of a let down but still nice.

text: Beautifully designed, spacious villa,.Massive bedroom separate from lounge area. Japanese syle bed and lounge, so comfortable. no kids policy ensures that extra piece and quiet. Good location, Anantara and a few other great eating, drinking spots walking distance. Staff go above and beyond to make you feel at home, food there was like going to a fancy restaurant. We got it on a sale period so offered great value but wouldn't pay standard rate only down side
title: Amazing

text: The hotel staff are helpful and very attentive. Breakfast was great and delivered to our room. Bathroom was clean and tidy. The only weak point was the weak water pressure of the shower, need to be upgraded. Anyway, we were still satisfied with our stay at the hotel overall.
title: Good villa
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan Raja Kamar

text: We visited Bali in November last year, and spent a thoroughly relaxing four days here. There's definitely a wow moment when you first step into his clean, spacious, enclave of sorts. It's way too big for two but we're not complaining! We loved the modern interiors, the wide DVD and cable selection and the fact that the bathroom opens up straight into the pool. I was skeptical at first about staying at a villa because of a bad experience with mosquitoes previously, but this wasn't a problem at all at Seiryu...you're safe from those vicious things here. The service was excellent too. The staff went above and beyond to cater to our needs and make us feel at home while also respecting our privacy. Gedei, one of the butlers, deserves praise for being exceptionally helpful and accomodating. Locationwise... It's not super close to central seminyak, but the beach is just a 5 minute walk away. If you plan on spending some time there, they provide free towels, deck chairs and umbrellas which is very useful. One thing that fell a little short of my expectations: the breakfast spread. You select your meal the day before, and they bring it to you when you get up. But the choices are limited, and the food not spectacular. That aside, Seiryu was a great, great choice for us. They only have eight or ten rooms in total....so you might want to book early!
title: Modern, spacious, mozzie-free!

text: Seiryu was lovely from the start. Fantastic service, gorgeous accommodation, fab breakfast served in room and attention to detail. It pleasure to stay. They even sent me a follow up email to say thank you and see if I enjoyed my stay. Location is fine. A bit of a stretch from Kuta Square, but quiet (also no kids policy). Definitely recommend.
title: Definite recommend

text: Seiryu Villas were spacious, well positioned, complete with every amenity needed and serviced impeccably. The construction of the villas is typical for Bali; asthetically pleasing yet up close a little rushed. The only thing about this that bothered us was that the doors were poorly fitted allowing a gap that mozzies could exploit at night. The blinds helped, as did the repellent left by the staff. The room service was well priced and mostly good. We would stay again if going to Seminyak.
title: Seiryu villas

text: The Seiryu is one of those smaller establishments with only 8 villas. This meant that we had a lot of privacy despite being right smack in the middle of the busy tourist scene. When you enter the premise, the dim corridor to the villas immediately shuts out the chaos happening outside and you feel at peace. As you enter your villa, the high walls may seem rather intimidating and enclosed, but it does a really good job of making you feel like you are secluded. The villa has a minimalistic theme, with high ceilings and modern decorations and the toilets were well equipped with a jacuzzi bath and a standing rain shower. The huge king sized bed was one of the comfiest I've slept in. The team is very friendly and because there weren't many villas to begin with, you were given their utmost attention and took the effort to learn your names. Because of the good location, we did not even use the shuttle provided, but commuted around in the taxis for $3 to $5 to most places. The breakfast prepared was very tasty and they were generous enough to give me more than one choice of breakfast when I couldn't make up my mind. In conclusion, I would definitely recommend this place to any couple as it is definitely value for money.
title: Great location, great for couples

text:
The Seiryu is hands down the best place to stay in Seminyak. 

Not only were the villas stunning, extremely clean (I'm a stickler for cleanliness, so take it from me) and in a great location but the staff were wonderful! 

Firstly, the villas were spacious and beautifully decorated and the pool and the outside area was gorgeous. The bed was perfect and we had an amazing sleep every night with the help of the three air cons in the room.

The highlight of our stay would have definitely been the wonderful staff at the Seiryu. They cooked us breakfast in our room every morning and organised us taxis and transfers wherever  we wanted to go. THEY WERE AMAZING, love you Mini <3
title: We didn't want to leave

text: We just returned from the villas.  The room is really huge, with a kitchenette where they served you daily breakfast.  Location is great, near to the busy street of Seminyak but the walk to the beach is a good 15mins as the deck chairs are located some distance away along the beach.  It's a great place for honeymooners, quiet and serene with great service.  This is if you do not want anyone in sight or do some people-watching.  There are only abt 8 villas and most of the time, you will not see other guests around.  However, there are no other facilities and breakfast lacks a bit of variety but if you are not into breakfast, it should be a good getaway for a few days.
title: Nice villas in a great location.

text: this is place is so perfect for honeymoon, my wife and i wanna come again sometimes.. private pool makes perfect, living room and kitchen make lazy day for us, the food is great serve by request delivery to our kitchen.
title: memorable

text:
My first word as we were shown to our villa was 'wow'! That thought did not leave me for our entire stay. The craziness of Seminyak fades as you walk through the door and it's easy to forget you are a short walk away from the action. 

The villa's are incredible, I especially loved the fact you could walk straight out your bathroom door into your private pool! 

A fantastic stay, would highly recommend.
title: Incredible Villa's in a great location.

text:
We had a weeks stay a this quietly located villa, with all the luxuries you expect.
Breakfast every morning either in your villa or beside your villa pool. Staff were exceptional, catering for every need. Beautifully appointed villa, with amenities only a 10 min walk away from main road, Seminyak. No fitness centre on premises but staff will advise on a gym close by. 
A must for honeymooners, or couples wanting to getaway and completely relax! 
Restaurants and more beauty treatments very close by.   Definitely recommend. ENJOY!!
title: Luxury and location at its best...

text: This was the first villa I have stayed in, in Bali. And it was amazing!!!! The villas were extremely private we didn't hear anyone or see anyone else except the staff for most of the trip! We celebrated my boyfriends birthday on our stay I organised with the staff a cake which they came to villa and surprised us which was lovely. Clean big rooms, nice and modern. Extremely comfy beds! The breakfast was delicious and always on time! We defiantly will be staying there next time we go! Also October weather is sensational! Highly rec this villa AND this time of year! - Carmen
title: Beautiful villas very private

text:
We have just returned from 8days stay at the seiryu. We had a delux pool villa A3. We loved the whole concept of these villas. Great location, a 10min leisurely work to beach. The staff headed by Mr Wedi was very friendly and attentive. As a mature couple the only thing we found a little difficult was that all the seating - lounge both indoors and out doors at situated at floor level and if agility is not a strong point the only place to sit was on the bed. This is not a criticism but a comment . Good restaurants close by and a great spa two doors away for massages , facials etc.
Thanks again to all staff we will be back, hopefully soon.
title: Oasis in Seminyak

text:
Perfect resort for Honeymoon couple. Private pool is big enough to have a quick swim and sun tan. Day bed by the pool gives it a nice touch too. Room is spacious with cold air conditioning. Very comfortable. Kitchen is well equipped with pots and pans to make our own dinner. It is separated from the room with a sliding door to give privacy when breakfast is delivered in the morning. Very well designed room layout as a whole, but slightly tired furniture (well maintained given that it is 6 years old)

Service is warm and genuine. With only 8 rooms in the entire villa, the personal touch and attention to details made those stay special and enjoyable. Staff are friendly and always around to assist.

In a nutshell, the well designed infrastructure is supported by warm and genuine service... and we enjoyed the entire experience. I'll highly recommend it to couples who are looking for a place lay around all day, but will like to hang out with the crowd once in a while. (Resort is about 10min walk from the beach)
title: Excellent honeymoon retreat

text: Royal pool villa is the way to go. Own private room, private pool, kitchen, living space, great king size bed, decor is great, day bed is awesome. Very spacious. very private, great for honeymooners/couples. Great location with a spa next door and beach close by, attentive staff, staff can call to do all the bookings you need done for dinners/tours etc. Great choices of breakfast in your own villa, room service is lovely. Japanese style villas, great choice of toiletries. Don't need to pack much to stay here. Bath robes and slippers provided among other toiletries. We always come back to these villas over and over...
title: love it!

text: Through the main doors, there is a picture perfect Japanese rock garden in the reception cum check in area. The corridor leading to the rooms was a bit dark but I guess is part of the samurai decor. Entering the room was a totally different experience. Bright and spacious. A day bed by the pool is a nice touch. A separate TV area and sleeping really worked for us. Breakfast is served in your personal dining room. Only complains are that The sliding doors couldn't close properly so we found Mosquitos wondering in at night and there are no black out curtains in the bed area so we were up at the crack of dawn!
title: Setup for couples. Not well kept.

text: The villas are absolutely beautiful and very very spacious. I regret that we had only 4 days here. All the staff members are very helpful. They booked all our sight seeing and water activities for us, and got us really good deals. It's at walking distance from the beach, and you can get taxis from right outside to visit Kuta/Legian at whatever time you please. The villas themselves are marvelous and very quiet. The private pool is decently sized, not just a plunge pool. The living room and bedroom areas are also plush and beautifully done up. Would love to go back soon.
title: Hidden gem

text:
We absolutely loved our stay at the gorgeous Seiryu Villas! The location is great although a lot of building work is going on around the villas at the moment. The villas are so close to Seminyak Beach. 
We loved everything about our stay. The staff are so helpful and booked our dinner reservations each night and helped us find great shopping. We loved coming home from a hectic day in Bali and taking a dip in our private pool. I have a Celiac Disease so was quite nervous about travelling to Bali, I emailed the Villas before leaving NZ and they kindly organised Gluten Free Bread and made me a delicious breakfast that was safe for me to eat which was divine. My partner loved the Japanese Breakfasts! We stayed in Villa B4.

We cant wait for our next trip!
Thank you again to the staff :)
title: In love with these Villas!

text: everything about this villa is sensational the staff especially who learnt our names and used them all the time.my wife had her birthday while we were their and they got a cake and came to our villa door and everyone from the villas sang happy birthday it was service with a capital S.i would have no problems recomendding this villa to any couples wanting a romantic holiday superb superb superb
title: sensational

text: My partner and I are from Hong Kong. Although we only spent a day in Seiryu, it really appreciated us. (We regret only book a day to stay in there actually :p )The staff was very helpful and nice, amenities are great. It is a wonderful place to stay! We love it so much and thank you :) Excellent services! The asset to Bali :)
title: Wonderful place to stay!!

text: We came back to Seiryu Villas after our first stay 3 years ago. We like the Seiryu a lot in particular because it's quiet (just 6 villas), quite close to the beach (5 mins walk and they can arrange transfer), and mostly because of the villas minimalistic Japanese style design. Staff is great and very helpful. As feedback I'd say they should improve on the quality of the breakfast, although it is served in the room, which is quite a nice thing to have (served, not cooked in the villa, reason why sometimes it gets to you not as hot as you'd like to). Tip: ask them in advance to cook it just before serving it. They also have beach facilities; tell them in advance you are planning to go to the beach and they'll reserve long chairs for you. Location is excellent as well. You can walk to the beach and in 10 mins you can walk to JL Oberoi, where most of shopping and dining is located.
title: Great Japanese style villa

text:
My partner and i are from Singapore. This stay was a surprise for me and he arranged everything. On arrival in Bali, a polite, friendly villa staff (Widi) picked us up from the airport. At the villa, my partner requested for the staff to buy me flowers for my birthday the next day. I received a surprise the next morning when staff greeted me with a birthday cake, singing and presenting me with the roses. 

Breakfast was pretty good and presented well. I enjoyed both the japanese and local breakfast which was served. 

The private pool, gazebo and tanning area werw perfect for tanning, lazing and quality couple time. Place is really quiet and relaxed. 

Rooms were clean and neat. Villa was located within walking distance from the beach and just next door to Lestari- a restaurant which serves excellent food.

Villa price is not exactly cheap but worth the money if you want to have that special time with your partner. Oh, and my partner proposed to me at the Villa!
title: Perfect for quiet, relaxed couple time

text: We spent 4 nights at The Seiryu Villa in July 2013 and loved it! The rooms are exactly as the pictures show but much more spacious than we expected. All of the staff were very friendly and remembered our names from the day we arrived (even staff that I am sure we had not met!) The location is perfect only 5 min walk to the beach or 10 min to the main shopping road. On reading other reviews we decided to try the French Toast for breakfast and it was amazing! I would highly recommend couples wanting a very private relaxing experience to stay here.
title: Perfect!

text: We spent a week at this villa and loved every minute. The staff are amazing, remember your name after one introduction and every greeting is genuine. I loved the decor, the rooms were very well maintained and generous in size. Although there were other guests at the villas we only saw other guests once, it's so quiet. This villa is close to the beach, great restaurants and shops. Would totally recommend and we will return on our next trip to Bali.
title: A great find

text:
The first look of it is just a box. No elegant entrance nor appearance. But do not be deceived by the appearance... My bf and I both agreed that there are hidden treasure in there. We basically love everything there. The breakfast, the facilities, the location and the staff. I booked the villa to celebrate my boyfriend's graduation and we both enjoyed staying there. It's cozy and the staff responded fast-Be it through email or during our stay there (as such, i'm pretty skeptical with travelers complaining about staff not replying to email). They are helpful and gave quite some recommendation for it is our first time there. In general, the place is clean, 7mins walk to Seminyak beach, 10mins walk to the main shopping street. There's a bar/restaurant, spa and laundry shop beside the villa as well.  Highly recommended!

Perhaps the only issue is that it's pretty dark outside of the villa after 6pm as Bali typically gets dark pretty early. Would be good if more lamps could be installed though (not sure if it's under the management of Seiryu).
title: Fantastic Place~ Treasure in a Box

text: We stayed in the Royal Pool Villa (B1). And you really do feel like royalty in this villa. I don't believe there is a huge difference to the deluxe villas. Not a request they couldn't assist with. They have a japanese influence with everything, even an option with Breakfast which was delicious. The butler Tapa was fantastic. Extremely helpful as we're the rest of the staff. More than happy to drop you off around the seminyak area or organise a taksi (taxi) or driver at your request. A 10 minute walk to the beginning of Eat street or a 2 minute drive. Highly recommend choosing to spend your stay at the Seriyu villas.
title: Sensational! Highly recommended for a Bali villa experience with a Japanese touch.

text: We stayed in Seiryu Villas for 1 week and did not want to leave. I could not fault the place. I absolutely loved the villa we stayed in - its really quiet and private but yet you are close to everything in Seminyak. The bed was huge and it was all very spacious.The staff were so friendly and helpful - especially Tapa, Senna and Minni. The food was delicious - I loved the breakfast (try the french toast!) and the meals were delicious. We had some spa treatments they organisd in our villa that were amazing! We really did not want to leave the place and I really recommend it. Perfect for a romantic couples holiday!
title: The Perfect Holiday!

text: We stayed in the Villa for 5 nights and could have stayed many more. The villa was huge. It had a lovely big bed, large lounge kitchen with dining room, spa bath, shower, separate toilet and bathroom. A good size lap pool and romantic day bed. The staff were perfect. Nothing was a bother. The breakfast was delivered by your butler each morning - lovely couldn't fault. The room was cleaned each day. Shops, beach and restaurants were walking distance. The laundry was 2 min away and so cheap. It was a lovely holiday and would recommend it.
title: ROMANTIC VILLAS

text:
My husband and I were looking for a lazy few days in Seminyak and we found it at Seiryu Villas.  The whole experience was one of luxury and we walked away feeling more relaxed than we have in a long time.

We were upgraded from a Deluxe to a Royal villa complete with a complete kitchen, daybed, plunge pool, jacuzzi and the most enormous king-sized bed.  For the additional $50 per night, we would highly recommend the upgrade - especially if you are planning to spend a lot of time in your villa.

The breakfasts (included in the price) were beautifully prepared and presented inside the villa - and we've been so spoiled that we're not sure we can go back to buffet!  The staff were delightful.. extremely friendly and helpful at any time of the day.

The location is also excellent being a short stroll from all the main Seminyak 'hot spots', if you're looking for a great range of places to eat and drink.  It is also a short 5 minute stroll to the beach (although, why would you when you have a gorgeous, private plunge pool and day bed?).

If we had to pick one thing (and it is tiny), the villas are starting to show a little 'tiredness'.  It's really minor things like a tile missing off the water feature and one small area of peeling paint on the exterior ceiling.  However, we (and I expect most reasonable person) would overlook.

Our overall impression was one of excellence.  The complex is extremely quiet, private and relaxing and I wouldn't hesitate in staying again.
title: To quote a friend.... "Salubrious"

text:
Took me a while to write my review, as I was struggling on whether is was a 4 or 5 star experience. Stayed at The Sieryu from 19 to 23 May – the entire experience in general was really great, but with a few flaws.

Upon arrival at the airport, and took the airport taxi which cost us IDR 120,000 after some haggling. Took about 30 minutes from the airport to the villa which was located in Seminyak area.It was a little difficult for the driver to locate, since he almost mistook another Jalan Drupadi Villa no 8, as the Seiryu, but credits to him, he checked and found the right place. From the outside, it looks like a very simple place with very high security, because you cannot see what’s in the villa at all ( not even from the reception). 

Upon check in, we had a very refreshing lemon grass soda and chilled towels which came at a great time to beat the super hot weather.As we were earlier than the usual check in time, our rooms were not ready, but Mini offered to safekeep our bags until our villa was ready. When we were back, our bags were already placed nicely in the villa, and Mini brought us for a villa tour. The walkway to the villa was really private and dark, with the doors of the villa on the right hand side. 

There are only 8 villas, so you can imagine the amount of attention you will received from the team :) We were celebrating our anniversary, and the team really made a very nice effort into preparing a honeymoon experience for us – From the flower petal arrangements on the bed and the Jacuzzi bathtub, to a slice of cake in the fridge, the surprise was really delightful!!

In summary, the pros:
-A lot of privacy in the villas
-Nice and luxurious rooms
-Friendly front desk and security staff who are really sincere in sharing their life stories with you
-Quiet area compared to kuta beach area, 
-Insect repellents in the rooms to reduce the number of flies coming in
-Very nice departure – when we were going to leave the hotel for the taxi, there was a row of staff at the entrance saying goodbye to you. Very nice gesture 
-Many massage and spa salons in that area – you can get a massage in a spa for about 20 bucks

The flaws that made us a little disappointed were: 
1)Inconsistent housekeeping standard - Our toiletries amenities were not replenished – shower caps, emery board etc, we had to reuse the ones until the last (4th) night, where the toiletries were magically replenished again. Not sure if it’s housekeeping or just the way it’s supposed to be
2)The flush system in the toilet didn’t work well , and we had to keep trying and trying until it works. While it’s not a big deal, it’s a little frustrating, and there was a day we just had to call the reception to resolve the issue
3)The wireless didn’t work at times – kept trying to log in the wireless in the day, but kept having intermittent connections, or couldn’t even connect. It works well at night. Might be good to just load all your info, and your maps for the places the night before.
4)Location not the easiest to find – drivers got confused with Villa no. 8 at Jalan Drupadi 8
5)Location a little far from the main Seminyak area – it’s about 10-15 minutes drive or 30 by foot

Thank you to the team at The Seiryu who made our stay so memorable!!
title: 5-star experiences, with some minor flaws

photos.caption: The garden area with massage beds for in-house massage
Gazebo to chill after a swim

text:
Villas about 7 years old and are showing signs of tiredness which is a pity as the concept is fabulous we didn't see any other guest there even though they were full -very private court yard plunge pool and day bed
Staff very attentive shuttle to either seminyak square or kuta ,breakfast choice good and served by butler in your villa -lots of new hotels going up in the area they will need to keep the decorative side in tip top condition .
title: Could be fantastic

text: We have just returned from our annual trip to Bali and this being our third time in Bali, we are very pleased that we have chosen Seiryu this time. We were in awe of the peacefulness and calmness of the villa once we stepped in, away from the bustling streets of Seminyak. We felt at home almost immediately when greeted by the staff members. Every display in the villa and its surroundings has a meaning to it and we find the culture there very refined. The villa itself had everything you ever needed and there is even a mineral water dispenser which saves you the time of boiling drinking water or risk getting a bali-belly (we experienced this the last 2 times we were in Bali). The staff member Tapa and Operations Manager Widyi was very helpful in booking a vehicle to take us out to the places we wanted to go and they made sure that all our needs were taken care of, including helping us to buy a local fruit to bring back to our home country. Another staff member, Mini was also very kind to bring external therapists (at a lower cost) to our villa for a private massage session as most of the spa services were fully booked. Breakfast is the most impt food of the day and they have done it to perfection especially the Japanese breakfast and fried banana fritters. They would deliver the breakfast to the villa at the appointed time and would re-heat up the food using the microwave in the villa again for our immediate consumption. Next to the villa is the famous Lestari restaurant and Mini was kind enough to help us take our supper order from the restaurant when their own kitchen has closed. On the day of our departure, the Operations Manager drove us to the airport and even brought us to a souvenir shop to do our last min shopping before continuing to the airport. This experience was immaculate and we will certainly return again. Well done!
title: Never regretted my stay in Seiryu!

photos.caption: Corridor to the villas decorated by samurai swords

text: Everything about the villa was perfect. Right from the booking, arranging of airport transfer, dinner etc was done with patience and attention to details on the staff's part was fantastic. Upon entering the villa, we immediately felt relaxed and the sense of calmness it projects is just amazing. The villa itself was really clean, spacious, and zen-like which we love. Jacuzzi bathtub, lightings and the bed was fantastic! Staff there were very patient and hospitable as it was our first time to Bali. Wife and me decided we'd be back here every chance we get.
title: Excellent villa for romance and relaxation

text:
s great and rooms were well maintained and cleaned. Staff are able to converse fluently in English. We are also satisfied with the breakfast variety. 

The villa is located 5mins (by taxi) away from Seminyak Square, and also well connected to the shopping streets at Seminyak. Famous restaurants such as Warung Mades and Ultimo are only 5 mins away. Chill out spots like Potato Head and Ku De Ta are also not too far away (15mins by taxi). 

It is also 10mins away from the Kuta Beach. Shuttle service is provided daily at 10am and 5pm (check with resort on updated schedule).

You might also want to make a reservation with Jerami Spa (sister company of The Seiryu) as they have nice spa packages at approximately IDR 680,000 for 2 hours. Complementary pick up and drop off service will be provided.

All in all, we had a great experience at The Seiryu on our first trip to Bali :)
title: Boutique hotel conveniently located at Seminyak

text:
Perfect Japanese ambience, excellent, cheerful and resourceful staff, central location, decent price, clean and clear private pool, lovely and yummy BBQ dinner, delightful breakfasts, cheap and caring transportation services, close access to beaches, spacious room, what more do you want?

I want clean towels without yellowish rusty stains
title: Excellent honeymoon resort

photos.caption: very interesting design of the door , can tell that the owner likes kendo
Nice breakbast served in our toom every day!
very comfortable bed near the pool, good for a snap in the afternoon
The outdoor private space, lovely garden

text:
Seiryu Villas was the perfect home for a beautiful holiday in Seminyak. Was a first time traveller to Bali last year and the friendly staff at Seiryu were accomodating to our every need. 

In general, the streets of Seminyak are crazy (but enjoyable) - so staying somewhere beautiful and worlds away is pretty important in keeping with a relaxed holiday mood. Once you step through the doors of the Seiryu Villas, you find yourself in an open plan Japanese styled zen garden with soothing incense burning, a pleasant change from the scent and riff raff of the streets that are just out front.

Situated on the more quiet end of Seminyak on Jalan Drupadi, nicely set away from the noise of the city, a beautiful place to getaway. Villa was very private, beautiful little pool and daybed that connect to a private bathroom - just perfect for couples. A motorbike is a must to quickly zip around the streets (Team on hand can provide you with the best contacts to hire one)

Lovely breakfast set up in our dining area everyday, the room was always tidied and reset with fresh towels and amenities everytime we would arrive back to the villa. Felt pampered and spoilt the whole time!

Money well spent and would definitely return.
title: Gorgeous place to stay

text:
We actually finished our trip in Seminyak with a 2 nights stay at Seiryu.
The place is located in a small street, not actually very nice, but you don't care as when you enter Seiryu you feel completely amazed by the place.
Service, staff, food, villas. Everything was amazing. Nothing to say. 
The hotel is very close to the beach (10 minutes walk) or the staff can drop you for free. 
We had only a very small issue, when we came back to the villa, they were still cleaning and to apologize they offered us a selection of sweats !
title: Very Nice Boutique hotel

text: The location, the setting, the staff, the service, the atmosphere... Everything was perfect! Set in the heart of seminyak minutes from the beach, shopping, and the best of Bali's restaurants. I could not recommend this place more highly and we will definitely be returning!
title: Perfection

text: My husband and I just returned from a week  @the seiryu villa's, celebrating my 40 th birthday. We couldn't have chosen a more perfect place to celebrate. The privacy of each villa, the friendliness of the staff,  and the facilities and location were all fantastic and the 'no child policy' (we have a child but she was not with us on this holiday) were exactly what we were after for our week away! The staff were all extremely wonderful, however Mini and Tapa made us feel like we were royalty, the chocolate cake/candles  and song Mini brought me on my bday made me feel very special, the way she walked us to our taxi and waved us farewell each time was a lovely touch and she was always there if needed. The bed was extremely comfortable, the rooms always clean and the pool perfect! We found the location to be central but located far enough to be quiet. This was our 8th visit to Bali and we have stayed in some lovely places, but if you are looking for peace, quite and comfort, seiryu is for you!
title: Bagus sekali

text:
Situated at the quiet and hard to find jalan drupadi, it all makes sense after just 1 night.  
You will be literally pampered the moment you stepped into the villa till you check out. The very personalised service by each staff simply make your money worth! It is not cheap honestly to spend a night there, but it is the environment and service by the staff that sets this place different from other hotels that were priced similarly. 
The butler service by Tapa and Mini was top notch. Like other reviewers, not only they gave good advices but are also like close friends to you. The owner should give them a good bonus for their excellent service. 
My wife and I were quite shocked when we were on our way out of the villa during checkout. The whole crew were at the gate bidding us goodbye and safe trip home. Awesome experience! I could go on and on, but you should decide yourself if you would like to pay them a visit to experience this awesomeness. 
From Boon and Linda.
title: Awesome is the only word I could use.

text:
We stayed here for 3 nights after checking the place out on a previous visit.  The villa was amazing and the service was exceptional.

From the moment we were picked up at the airport (the cold towels and bottled water in the car were a nice touch) until we left the service was faultless.

The villas are perfectly laid out and decorated beautifully.  The outdoor area was wonderful (I'd read a couple of reviews saying that the pools were too cold, we found ours to be perfect and I'm pretty sensitive when it comes to cold water)

We had the American breakfast the first day, which although quite good, was surpassed by the continental breakfasts the next two days (the french toast in particular!)

The high walls mean you have complete privacy, and we never heard another guest during our entire stay.

The bed is very large and extremely comfortable, we both managed to catch up on some well needed sleep on our trip.

We will definitely return.
title: Absolutely Amazing

text: Sitting thousands of miles away from your hotel options, reviews help you imagine the reality. Often rhetoric and opinion don't match the images in your head. The Seiryu Villas in Seminyak were just as I had hoped, and even went beyond imagination. Yes, the staff were exceptional. Yes, the location is within a short walk to the old Seminyak, but far enough to protect you from the clutter and kitsch. Yes, the zen calm is undeniable. But the architect was cleverer than the interior designer. Stepping straight out of the bathtub into the private pool was delightful, as was the secluded garden space. Could not say the same for the artwork in the rooms. Its great when room service breakfast is the norm rather than the exception. But be aware that the upmarket shopping street is a taxi ride away.Also ensure that your eyes are peeled to the pavements, so full of open gutters and gaping holes you could end up in plaster of paris. It was always a relief to get back to the white serenity of Seiryu.
title: White Serenity

text:
My husband & I stayed at the Seiryu for 5d/4n earlier this February. We had the most amazing time in Bali! Not to mention it was our first time there & that we were on our honeymoon. Most of the best times we had was just staying in our villa & relaxing.

The villa was superb! It was huge! Even my family & friends who saw our photos liked it very much. Such great space for a getaway indeed. Also, it was very near Seminyak beach!

Once we've walked in our villa, my hubby & i knew it would be very hard to step out. We had our own pool, a grand bed, 2 TV sets, an awesome living room area, a kitchen, daybed, even the toilet, shower, tub were unbelievable! Everything kept us in awe & we felt we couldn't ask for more.

The service was also top-notch! Everybody was always willing to help & was very accommodating & super nice! 

The food was also something to look forward to. We loved Seiryu's Japanese breakfast which felt like a heavy lunch or dinner 'cause of the large portions! 

Overall, great satisfaction guaranteed! Keep it up, Seiryu! We can't wait to come back!
title: Our Piece of Heaven

text:
I spent 2 night on Seiryu, for my anniversary with my wife. I Stay on Royal Villa
The staff is very friendly, the breakfast is fantastic, we have offered to choose 1 of 3 choices, american, japanese, or indonesian breakfast. all of 3 is delicious, and it served on our villa.
the room very clean, and the pool is rather warm,.
The special' one is the bathroom have stream jacuzzi bathtub. All situation on villa is very calm and we got privacy.
The lamp inside the private pool is broke, i like swim on the night, and it's rather dark on the water, but pool overall is ok.
The Villa place 10-15 minute to walk to raya seminyak/shopping street, on the way to raya seminyak i saw at least 3 minibar or pub around the street,but to go to shopping street I have to through a VERY DARK area..little scarry, but fortunatelly nothing bad happened on us...:). I see the dark area is now being built construction for Big Hotel , may several month again, this become brighter.

Must come again..
title: Perfect..

text: My boyfriend and I began our vacation in Bali at the Seiryu and we were so glad we chose this property. Located close enough to walk to the main shopping and dining area in Seminyak but far enough away to not hear the noise we were glad to be able to divide our time between relaxing and exploring the town. Although it was the rainy season, we were able to enjoy the private pool and lounge bale several times over our 3 nights. Somehow we managed to never see any other guests at the Seiryu, which made it feel like our own private resort! Breakfasts brought to our villa each morning were spectacular and among our favorite meals in Bali. The staff was very accommodating and helpful in arranging our very late pick up from the airport when we arrived. We were very pleased with how large the villa was...probably the biggest room we had over our entire trip. For the location, quality of service and truly 5 star amenities, this was a great deal if you're looking for a relaxed visit to Seminyak.
title: Perfect retreat in Seminyak

text:
Everyone at the Seryu from our first Internet contact to our departure transfer ensured we had the most peaceful and enjoyable holiday.The villa has everything we needed for a private luxurious and revitalising break away.The unique Japanese influenced villa style offers an experience that most 5 star hotels cannot emulate.

The location is great- not on main road yet close (700m) to the beach and yet only 900m from Seminyaks main shopping strip- gado gado is also just down road.

The service is in all respects 5 star- Tapa's butler team was attentive,fast and nothing was ever a problem.They focused on making our experience the best it could be but managed to maintain the perfect balance between service and privacy.

The food service was perfect- Breakfast is a must with choice of American ,Continental , Indonesian.The light mealchoices for lunch/dinner are just as good.

The private pool in a peaceful courtyard was the just the place to enjoy everything - its exactly like it is in the photos.

We were sad to leave and hope to return soon!
title: Sensational Seiryu

text: Staff = excellent. Villa = beautiful. Facilities = lacking for nothing. Everything we wanted from a Bali villa experience, we found at Seminyak's the Seiryu villas. The concept of the villa is so different to the others, it truly was an oasis of calm in bustling and busy Seminyak. The villas are well appointed with great decoration and my girlfriend wanted to stay there a lot longer and not continue the rest of our trip! The location is great on Jalan Drupadi, about 10 mins walk from main Jalan Raya Seminyak and the great shopping along there. The Seiryu is tucked away down a side street (Jl Drupadi) and is very quiet. Whether you book a Deluxe suite or a Royal suite you won't be disappointed. The owner of the Seiryu is Japanese and as such has taken great care to maintain its Japanese themed decor. We couldn't fault the place. They provided unfailingly helpful service. Many thanks especially to our butler Tapa, who drove us all over Bali as well as looking after us at the villa. We wouldn't hesitate to come back again.
title: Thank you Seiryu

text:
Nice little getaway with your very own private pool. Service was great as breakfast is served in your room daily. The pool was a bit small for serious swimming but it's good enough for some gentle exercising. 

It's located near the beach, practically within walking distance so it's great to go there in the evening to watch the sunset. 

Free wifi is always something i look for and Seiryu has it.

Staff were very helpful and friendly. Would give them top marks for making my stay a great one.

If you need to eat something, hop next door to Lestari Grill & Pasta. Search it on tripadvisor and you'll want to visit it on your next tri
title: Nice little villa to escape from the city life!

photos.caption: The living room. Through the glass door is the private pool area
The breakfast setup that greets you each morning!

text:
Nice little getaway with your very own private pool. Service was great as breakfast is served in your room daily. The pool was a bit small for serious swimming but it's good enough for some gentle exercising. 

It's located near the beach, practically within walking distance so it's great to go there in the evening to watch the sunset. 

Free wifi is always something i look for and Seiryu has it.

Staff were very helpful and friendly. Would give them top marks for making my stay a great one.

If you need to eat something, hop next door to Lestari Grill & Pasta. Search it on tripadvisor and you'll want to visit it on your next trip.
title: Great place for privacy and to get away from it all

photos.caption: The living room. The private pool is out towards the door

text:
We had been recommended to the Seiryu Villas by friends who had stayed there a few times.  After spending 10 days here, we understand why they keep coming back. 
Location: close to the beach, Gado Gado restaurant and generally a great central spot to walk anywhere in Seminyak. Just off the main road, so limited road noise.  No pubs next door, so no all night music. Lestari restaurant next door is a gem. 
Villa: very clean, spacious, well appointed, bed was huge (and I'm 6'3"), a private oasis.
Staff: always very helpful, super polite and courteous.
Meals/Room Service: good quality and sizable breakfasts. Assisted us with set-up for entertaining some friends for pre-dinner drinks in our villa. 
As a final gesture of their amazing service, every one of the staff came out and said goodbye to us on our departure to the airport. We were very touched by this. We loved it here and definitely be back.
title: Fantastic Experience

text:
What an amazing place. We stayed here for 2 weeks at the beginning of November. I have been to Bali many times but it was my partners first time. I couldn't have found a better place to stay and will definitely be back. 

The staff were incredible, friendly, helpful and went out of their way to make you feel at home, not in a hotel. The villas are in a great location, slightly tucked away from the busy main streets and only a short 5-10 min walk to the beach and those amazing sunsets. Our Villa A4, was at the very end of only 8 villas, a great feature as its never busy and we hardly saw another guest the whole time in any of the villas. The high walled courtyard gave us the privacy we desired but allowed all the sun in to our private pool, cabana and deck. The interiors were modern, stylishly simple and very comfortable, the air conditioning was ice cold (much needed with the high humidity) and the bed is much bigger than a standard king bed size in Australia and one of the most comfortable beds we've stayed on in a hotel/villa. 

Breakfast each morning was delivered on time and at a time you select and a portion of it prepared onsite in the villa, a nice touch. The room service menu was varied with some very nice options. A special feature of this place is the BBQ they prepare next to your pool inside your villa. We weren't sure about this as there are so many great places to eat in Seminyak and it seemed a bit of a gimmick, BUT oh my goodness, it was so lovely. We had the BBQ on one of the last nights and wished we'd discovered this little romantic treat earlier, we'd have had it more than once. 

I really can't say enough about the villas, the location and most importantly the staff. I was genuinely saddened to leave when our time came to head to the airport.The upside is, we are heading back early next year and I know we will be staying here again.
title: Effortlessly luxurious

text: Were were collected from the airport and discovered at reception that our villa was not quite ready so they offered us a meal and drinks, then an hour long massage each in the Vitamin Organic Spa next door.  Very nice after a long flight.  Once inside our villa we were amazed how spacious it was.  Lounge, dining and kitchen area, and large bedroom - both areas with flat screen TVs.  King size bed was super comfortable. Great bathroom which opened out onto the lap pool.  Outdoor area with sun beds and shade umbrella, and also large day bed in a separate shaded area, very comfortable.  We didn't get any noise from adjoining villas, and the sound of the water feature cascading into the pool was very relaxing. Breakfasts were served in the villa and were OK. Staff were always very friendly and helpfull, making dinner reservations and recommendations. Location is a bit of a walk to Seminyak beach and there are a couple of sun lounges available a bit up the beach if you can find them.  All in all our five days here were very relaxing.
title: Huge Villa, very peacefull stay

photos.caption: from the bathroom directly out into the pool, with the day bed at other end
Looking through to dining area and kitchen
Lounge room looking out to courtyard

text:
From check in to check out, The Seiryu Villa and its staff took very good care of us, excelling with their conscientious approach. My husband and I stayed in a one bedroom pool villa (A2) for three nights in late October. The hotel itself has a beautiful feel about it, very well maintained (just like the photos on the website). Great access to the beach (about a 10min walk) and close to the main shopping area (just a small taxi ride away). It was really quite refreshing to stay in a place with Japanese design with touches of Bali throughout, the pool area in the villa was especially beautiful. Our bed was huge and we found it super comfy. The pool area was completely private. The breakfast was good, although a little inconsistent (sometimes forgetting toast etc).
All in all we had a lovely time and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a little indulgence and some peace and quiet. One thing the staff could improve on is the communication between guest and front of house, but apart from that we found it a 'great stay!'.
title: A brilliant little find!!

text:
Unique villa concept, beautiful modern designed villa with Japanese theme based on the four seasons. Each seasons will have different colour themes and the hotel staffs will explain story behind every design elements which is interesting.

The reception area is small and cozy but beautiful decorated with florals, paintings and there's an area cover with stone craving, sands and jade lookalike items. The device is excellent, attentive, friendly and helpful which make us feel very at ease and welcome! 

The villa is not huge, good size and quite compact. They have everything you need in a villa and all necessarities. Upon entering, you have a small pouch area with a day bed and sun chairs by the pool. Inside the villa, there a living room with a huge tv, sofa is comfortable, aircon is working well! 

As for the bedroom, it Is huge and comfortable with a big TV in front of the bed, great for viewing, good distance. The bathroom has a shower area and a bathtub that can lead you directly to the pool, very cool and convenient! 

As for the kitchen, it is quite big, they have a dining area and a well equipped kitchen that you can do the cooking! The breakfast and room service food were well presented and delicious! A great place to relax and enjoy! 

But location wise, not so ideal. Far from the central of Seminyak.
title: Beautiful modern villa with Japanese theme, unique villa!

text:
villas are gorgeous! staff are great and service is quick and efficent!
we stayed at the villas for our honeymoon in late august and it was great
It was my partners favourite place in bali.
only small place of about 8 villas which are all so roomy!
your own pool, spa, living, dining room, kitchen, outdoor shower, tvs and dvd players. ipod docks.
was great was def value for money and def recommend if you want to induldge
title: your own little haven in bali

text:
It is my first experience living in a villa with private pool so i don't have any past experience to compare with, but i believe this is a great villa without comparing to any others. 
It only has eight villas, each with different style (as said in the website) and i have made request for a room excluding some style i personally not favorable and they have done well to be able to accommodate our request. 
They provide pick-up and drop off service from and to airport or even to or from location in between instead which is wonderful.
Their services are really provided with hearts and can see their attention to details. 
The mosquito issue, which i believe should be common in Bali (as i have lived in other hotel in this trip), is not serious. As told, they kill mosquito twice per week and they have done that after we check-in and we don't have too much problem with the mosquito thereafter during our stay. 
the private pool is nice and the size of the room is huge!!
The breakfast service is on-time everyday, but i do find the calling about it (2-3 times relating to the breakfast a bit too much when i am still sleeping and trying to get up:)) a bit too much in my opinion. However, i think this is something hard to fault them.
One thing is that the location and the address is a bit confusing and most taxi driver don't know the location of the hotel...So it is recommended to remember the street and location on your first day of your stay before your taxi driver got lost:)
title: Great villa

text:
This is the place to go if you want to have a quiet retreat.  The villa has all the indulgences - lounging-style living room to watch TV all day, or you could watch TV on the bed - both equipped with DVD players. Decent wifi. Jacuzzi. Pool.  Day bed with the soothing splashes of water by the pool to catch up on your reading.  Heck, even a laundry rack given the ample space if you want to do your basic laundry.

To top it off, the place is not exactly at a secluded (thus inconvenient) location.  Flanked by 2 fantastic restaurants - Delicious Onion and Lestari - both offering different (and very good quality) cuisine, you could just spend a week without walking more than 50 meters away for your meals. The Vitamin spa next door is also decent and have very skilled therapists.  Cabs are easy to get along this street as well.  And a short walk will bring you to the busy shopping area.  

I wish we could stay more than the 4 nights there.
title: Quiet haven

text: We recently returned to the Seiryu for our second visit after honeymooning there 2 years ago. This time for an extended 3 week stay to really wind down and enjoy the delights of Bali. We love everything about the Seiryu; the villa layout, the facilities, the location and especially the staff and management. They really can't do enough for you and are the most delightful group. We did notice that all the staff from our last visit were still there and the welcome received was wonderful. Seminyak is changing with large hotels going up the area and villas like the Seiryu will be paradise in a sea of boring hotel rooms. We highly recommend this establishment and look forward to our next visit in a few years time.
title: A great Villa

text:
Where to go for Honeymoon? Very difficult question to answer as it will always be unforgettable no matter it was a disaster or a great pleasure. Deciding on your destination is just first step to take followed by your accomodation preference. We picked Bali as our honeymoon destination but had tough time while selecting the hotel. Therefore, I decided to write on Tripadvisor, at least to make it easier for you, if you also picked Bali for your honeymoon. 

I will keep it simple for you according to my Bali experience; If you are interested more in:

1. sandy beaches, turtle island, seawalk; then go to Nusa Dua. 
2. culture, rice terraces, volcanoes, souvenirs, temples; then go to Ubud.
3. social life, good restaurants, bars, shops; then go to Seminyak.

If you go for Seminyak and need some privacy then Seiryu Villas would be one of the bests; it was for us. Our villa B2 and its private swimming pool made us feel as if we were in the heaven. Staff was, first of all very respectfull, and very friendly. The villa was quite spacious, clean and tidy and very well designed.

We had our first dinner at restaurant KU DE TA; second dinner  at restaurant BREEZE and the third and last one (Balinese barbeque) in the hotel in our private villa nearby the swimming pool.

In the end, my wife and I would recommend Bali for your honeymoon; Seminyak in Bali and Seiryu in Seminyak.
title: Honeymoon, Bali, Seminyak, Seiryu Villas.

text:
We just got back from our stay at Seiryu Villa, so we can still feel the excitement and the kindness of the staff still fresh in our mind. We stayed there for 3 nights and we absolutely had a great time! I guess they don't have so many staff, thus sometimes we were served by the same person and somehow it built familiarity and made us feel fully comfortable. The facilities were also great. As we went there to spend our honeymoon, they prepared everything just perfect. A bathtub full of flower petals, fruit basket, wine and a honeymoon cake were waiting for us when we got there, sweet! 
They were also set-up a romantic dinner for us and again, it's perfect. 
We enjoyed our time there and absolutely be back there someday!
title: Thanks Seiryu! Highly recommended for couple :)

photos.caption: Japanese Platter -- one of breakfast choices

text: Seiryu villa is one of my favorite private villa in seminyak area at bali. I love every details of villa design. It,s very japanese style. Villa maintenance and services always up to profesional level. All the staffs was very helpful and always on front line if u need them. One of my concerned is a gazebo bed  a bit dirty, they should change or clean it. I,m still Very recommended this villa for a couple who seeking private profesional villa at bali.
title: spacious room and great services

text:
Seyru Villa is a very cool place, with a very modern and minimalistic Japanese style design. We very much liked the look of the place as far as the lobby and the private villa are concerned. The location is quite good, just a few minutes walk from Gado Gado Street where restaurant and bars are located and despite of this, the place is extremely quiet and excellent for relaxation. The private pool and garden do the rest. We liked the breakfast served in the room, but the downside is that the food always turned up rather cold. They should improve on this. If you like to go to the beach, they provide beach chairs and shuttle service. 
All in all a very good and relaxing experience.

Restaurant tip: make sure you go to Matis restaurant and try the Moroccan lamb and the pistachio and chocolate souffle'
title: Very cool place

text:
We have travelled to Bali and stayed in various properties every time.

Was I the only guest in the 8 villas?????? It seemed like it but the honest answer is they were full

All I need to say is

The staff were never seen, but everything was done 200%.
The villa was private, very large (Royal Pool villa) and was presented impeccably.
5 minute walk to the beach and the general location was very good.

The only MINOR negative was that we were the closest villa to the reception and the telephone was quite loud when ringing in reception due to the sound traveling quite easily with concrete walls & floors etc.

Will definatley be back......
title: Relaxation at its best

text: Was sensational. Highly recommend. Treated like a princess. Absolute luxury - no complaints. 5 stars!!!!!!  Staying in Bali for 1 month at 4 other different places, this was the highlight of our trip hands down. Can't recommend it enough!!!
title: PERFECT!!!!

text: The Seriyu was warm and inviting,with the staff only to happy to make all arrangements for you.The room was huge and well set out with high walls surrounding you.Made Sande  the manager personally drove us to the airport and saw us off. The room service was prompt and tasty(try the fried banana). All  up a well run and comfortable stay
title: Great little villa

text: We have just returned from a five night stay at the Seiryu. What a joy. We escaped from the kids and found ourselves in an oasis within a paradise. The villa was amazingly spacious with plunge pool and garden area. Sun lovers may feel a little put out after the shadows creep in around 4pm. The location was an easy walk to the beach or seminyak square. Service was friendly and efficient, although as with most places in Bali after few days the staff treat you more like family than paying guests and some things may need to be asked for. King bed was super comfortable and sleep easy and peaceful. We would go back in a heartbeat.
title: A wonderful space in a wonderful location.

text:
Firstly, I want to make the point that the Seiryu has the potential to be great, however unfortunately there were a few too many points that negatively impacted our experience.So I'll start with the negatives... as soon as we entered the villa I noted that the pool side area had some green scum/mildew that needed to be water blasted as well as some of the bricks. When we entered the building, the wooden floors looked scuffed and dusty - difficult to rub out. The first night we we were there I was attacked by mosquitos while sleeping - at least 20 bites! I was miserable. Strangely my partner wasn't bitten, maybe my blood is sweeter! (Didn't expect bites to be an issue in Seminyak coming from Ubud and with windows shut) We mentioned this to the staff and they did double the number of anti-bug plug-in things which seemed to help. By the third night our air-con in the main area had also given up. Breakfast was filling but nothing special - indonesian noodles is probably the best option. On our last day they served breakfast 30 mins early which was a little odd. We were in the Deluxe Villa which has the kitchen/ table at the back of the villa. It's set back from everything and is not very welcoming. Although it's a full kitchen, it doesn't have things like bowls or dinner plates? 

The set up is very private and tranquil. But the layout means you don't really get the sun after 3.30pm. 

The good points / potential: it's a really impressive set up. The plunge pool that enters directly to the bathroom, and the loungers are comfy. Service was friendly and pleasant. 2 TVs means you can watch from the bed or lounge. If it was given a bit of a spring clean e.g. water blasting, polishing floors again, it would look really good. We though the location was good too - try the Delicious Onion restaurant next door. Fruit bowl, four bottles of mineral water each day and nightly turn down service. 

Rereading the review, I do sound rather negative!!! But I think when you're paying $300+ per night, you do expect the attention to detail.
title: Good but not great

text: I stayed at Seiryu for 3 nights and had just come from a different resort in Seminyak as I wanted to try different accommodation. The villas are quite beautiful and the food is better than the other hotels. Our villas were thoroughly cleaned everyday and even our clothes which were almost scattered all over our villa was nearly folded in a pile for us. But that's all that's good about this villa. I food staff to be fake - seemed like they were over their jobs. The female staff especially had an attitude problem. Location requires walking everywhere. I suggest you stay around Seminyak square, not this area as it is on a dark long road. There is contraction going on too, and the noise went On from morning to dawn! Lets just say you can get better value for your money somewhere else. Overall stay was just ok.
title: Expected more not as good as other hotels

text:
This is our 5th time to Bali in a space of 18 months and we wanted to stay in Seminyak in a quiet and romantic location.

My wonderful Partner spent time researching and to our great delight came across The Seiryu.

It is located off the main road to Gado Gado Restaurant opposite "The Breeze's Hotel Complex" (100 metres) and tucked away in a long narrow block.

We were greeted by a very polite doorman / security and shown into the foyer where freindly and polite staff checked us in.

After check in we were taken down a long narrow corridor to our Villa.

As soon as the main door from the long corridor was opened we were caught out by a wonderful courtyard (plunge pool, garden, deck chairs and day bed) before being given a tour of the Villa.

We stayed in late April (2012) for a week and enjoyed every minute.

You order your breakfast the afternoon before and it arrives at the time you ask. The breakfast was well worth the experience.

My partner has always mentioned she hasn't found a place she'd love to stay at again - Now she has

we've recommended and would thoroughly recommend this complex to anyone wishing a romantica and secluded getaway

We'll be back
title: Peaceful and content

text:
The Seiryu is a retreat from the hustle and bustle of the area and from the moment you arrive it does portray and exclusive villa complex of 8 one bedroom villas.  I stayed in Royal villa which are B1-4 with Deluxe villas further down the dark entrance as A1-4.  The villa is extremely spacious and has everything that you need and actually would be a perfect home and twice the size of any 1 bedroom in Hong Kong!  I booked direct and got 35% off but even at this price I would not want to pay more than what i did which was USD300 inc tax/service.  There are much better one bedroom villas to stay at for this price or even stay at the W Seminyak which is hip and fun.

If you worship the sun or at least want some sun these these villas are not the place to be.  You only get sun until about 2pm and if you're thinking of going for a splash.  There isn't much opportunity as the pool is more of a punch pool that is absolutely freezing!

The breakfast is served in your villa and the best thing to order is the Indonesian noodles, other than that go to Gado Gado or one of the other local hip spots for a much better breakfast.

I had arrangd for a car to collect fromthe airport but that was no where to be seen so I had to make my own way in a taxi for 70,000 IDR and when I arrived no apology that the car wasn't there.  I was lucky I knew the road was Drupadi otherwise no one would have found it as pronouncing the name to locals they don't have a clue.  Location is ok but if yu wanted to walk to eat street in Seminyak it will take you about 30 mins, other than that there are not a lot of restaurants around.  La Sal up the road was fantastic for Spanish and other Mediterranean specialities?

It is nice that no children permitted here and is a place to relax and rejuvenate.
title: Amazinig villa but not for sun worshipers!

text:
We have stayed at The Seiryu Villas for the past few years in Villa B1 and have found it to be a wonderful relaxing, quiet retreat with the most wonderful staff.  Every need is met with a smile and we certainly feel like part of a special family.  We are 2 singles who enjoy being in the heart of Seminyak but also relish the peace and quiet once you walk through the door into the villa. A short walk to the beach but also a wonderful space to relax by the pool if you choose.  

We cannot recommend The Seiryu highly enough because everyone goes out of their way to make your stay as pleasurable as possible. We will be returning again and again.
title: Beautiful Bali at The Seiryu

text: My wife and I stayed during the first week of June in a Royal Deluxe Villa. Apart from the slight hiccup with the driver being 30 mins late on our arrival due to Bali traffic, the rest of our stay was a great experience.
